The best of the best from around the world will play MechAssault on Xbox Live. Are you ready?"

71778.name: Super Adventure Island
71778.description:
"Super Adventure Island (高橋名人の大冒険島, Takahashi Meijin no Daibōken Jima, "Master Takahashi's Great Adventure Island") is a platform game by Hudson Soft for the Super NES. It was first released in Japan on January 11, 1992. The game was then released in the United States in April of that year, and in Europe that November 19. It is the third game in the Adventure Island series, and was followed by New Adventure Island, Adventure Island 3, Super Adventure Island II and Takahashi Meijin no Bōken Jima IV, a Japanese exclusive for the Famicom."

Source: Wikipedia, "Super_Adventure_Island," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

71779.name: The Conduit
71779.description:
From the back of the case

" 'Best Shooting Game on the Wii.'

Dive into the award-winning shooter game featuring a conspiracy-laden single-player campaign and intense multiplayer modes. Arm yourself with an arsenal of sci-fi gadgets and high-powered weapons as you fight against aliens, rogue agents and other enemy forces.

In the world of The Conduit, the truth may not be what it seems.

Play the way you want with fully customizable controls and robust calibration.

Dominate your friends in up-to-12-person online multiplayer battles!

Solve puzzles, uncover hidden enemies and reveal the secrets of The Conduit."

71780.name: Super Adventure Island II
71780.description:
"Super Adventure Island II (高橋名人の大冒険島Ⅱ, Takahashi Meijin no Daibōken Jima Tsū, "Master Takahashi's Great Adventure Island II") is a Super NES video game by Hudson Soft and was the final entry in the series, until Hudson announced in 2009 a new game on WiiWare called Adventure Island: The Beginning. Unlike most of the previous games, this one is not a straight platformer; instead, it plays like an action/adventure game that encourages exploration, similar to the later Wonder Boy games."

Source: Wikipedia, "Super_Adventure_Island_II," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

71781.name: Endless Ocean: Blue World
71781.description:
The story of Adventures of the Deep begins in the fictional Paoul Republic, where the player (who may choose either a male or female character), currently studying folklore at university, takes a break to find out more about the "Song of Dragons" and becomes part of the R&R Diving Service, whose aims range from collecting lost cargo to taking photographs of rare species of fish. The plot centers around a woman called Océane Rouvier, whose grandfather, Jean-Eric Rouvier, is the head of the service, and who will serve as the player's diving partner through the course of the game. Océane lives with her grandfather following the death of her father, Matthieu, who founded the R&R Diving Service alongside Jean-Eric and who was investigating the existence of the Song of Dragons before his death.

Blue World features improved graphics, larger explorable areas than the previous game, and allows players to travel to six different diving spots around the globe, including new polar and river locations.

The ability to dive with a dolphin as a companion returns from the first game, and players will now also be able to ride them to move quickly through the water. Players can also sell salvaged treasure for money that can be used to buy items to decorate their private reef and aquarium. Potentially dangerous creatures such as sharks and crocodiles will now elicit a warning for players and may even attack them; players will be able to drive them off using a new tranquilizer-like tool called the Pulsar which calms them down. The Pulsar can also be used to heal any creatures the player finds that are unwell.

Source: Wikipedia, "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Endless_Ocean_2:_Adventures_of_the_Deep," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

From the back of the NA case

"Dive into an endless adventure beneath the waves!

Explore exotic locations, interact with over 300 species of aquatic life, and search for sunken treasure across the globe!"

71782.name: Swarmp'd!
71782.description:
Swarmp'd! is a highly tactical/strategical game. Each player has a creature swarm consisting of 16 animals/insects (3 Lizards, 3 Frogs, 2 Waterbugs, 2 Spiders, 2 Mosquitos, 2 Turtles, one Snake and one Crocodile) which forms their creature pool. Their goal is to eliminate/nullify their opponents swarm in order to win the game.

Each turn, you have the option to either place a creature tile or move a creature. Each creature has differing abilities, from the lizards' unlimited perimeter movement, to the crocodiles' ability to eat and kill each of its' opponents' creatures it finishes its' moves on.

Swarmp'd! is an abstract hexagonal tile based game of great skill with no "luck-factor" involved.

Can you literally Swarmp your opponent??? Play and find out......

71783.name: Lufia & the Fortress of Doom
71783.description:
"Lufia & the Fortress of Doom (エストポリス伝記, Esutoporisu Denki, officially translated as Biography Estpolis) is an RPG with puzzle elements developed by Neverland and published by Taito in 1993, for the Super Nintendo. It is the first title in the Lufia series of video games and the only game from the series released under the Taito label in North America."

Source: Wikipedia, "Lufia_&_The_Fortress_of_Doom," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

71784.name: Warlords of the Accordlands: Monsters and Lairs

rpghonor.13732: 2007 ENnie for Best Art, Interior - Nominee

71784.description:
From the back of the book:

The Accordlands are a dangerous place to journey alone. From forests teeming with undead abominations, to wastelands crawling with monstrous beings born of nightmare, an adventurer must be ready for deadly encounters at any turn. Chaotic Abyssals crawl from the depths of the earth, ancient dragons swell in remote locations, and all manner of strange and fantastic creatures stalk the land.

The monsters in this book provide a Dungeon Master with everything he needs to make his player' campaign anything but easy. Many of the most common and bizarre monsters of the Accordlands are detailed within, from the common Brine Fiend to the might Qor-Teth. Will your players remain on the surface, delve deep into the Abyss, or fight against the divine guardians of the heavens? The information for all is contained in these pages.


Hundreds of monsters native to the Accordlands.
Lairs for many of the monsters, complete with full color maps and mini-adventures.
Rules for creating player characters out of nearly any monster in the Accordlands.
Rules for designing your own monsters for use in your campaign.
Templates for turning any character into a special type of monsters, such as ghouls, wraiths, and shadow creatures.

71785.name: Lufia II: Rise of the Sinistrals
71785.description:
"Lufia II: Rise of the Sinistrals (エストポリス伝記II Estpolis DenkiⅡ in Japan) and Lufia in Australia is an RPG game with puzzle elements developed by Neverland and published in Japan in 1995 by Taito, and in North America and Europe in 1996 by Natsume and Nintendo respectively, for the Super Nintendo video game console.

Lufia II is a prequel to the first Lufia game, Lufia and the Fortress of Doom. It follows the story of the first main character's ancestor, Maxim, and explains the origins of the war between mankind and a group of superhumans called Sinistrals.

Lufia II made a number of changes from the first game. Dungeons no longer have random encounters and there are hundreds of puzzles throughout the game, ranging from simple to extremely challenging. It also introduced new skills, such as a variety of weapons that could be used to stun monsters or solve puzzles, and IP attacks."

Source: Wikipedia, "Lufia_II:_Rise_of_the_Sinistrals," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

71786.name: Warlords of the Accordlands: The Campaign Adventure Book

rpghonor.13732: 2007 ENnie for Best Art, Interior - Nominee

71786.description:
From the back of the book:

The Accordlands are held hostage. A secret group of the most deadly and powerful people in the world are hatching their plot to bring the world under their boots. Their plots have spread war and chaos throughout the land, and cost the lives of the most noble. The world has called for heroes, and none that answered the call have survived. Will you be next to stand up to the challenge?

The Campaign Adventure Book gives Dungeon Masters everything they need to run a group of players through one of the greatest chapters in the history of the Accordlands: the epic battle with the Medusan Lords. Through battles with feudal Warlords, to fights with the Medusan's protector the Dragon Lord, players will find themselves caught in a web of adventure that will decide not only the fate of all mortal life on Larnisar, but even that of the gods and existence itself!


24 Adventures!
Characters progress all the way from level 1 to 20 through the campaign.
Many new NPCs and monsters of the Accordlands created exclusively for these adventures.
Statistics for famous characters from the Warlord Collectible Card Game, including the summoner Sorscha, the Dragon Lord, and the vile Medusan Lords.
Challenges unlike those ever faced before.
Complete maps for all 24 adventures.

71787.name: Escape Clause
71787.description:
From the back of the adventure:

"What does a hostile extraction that goes awry have to do with a clandestine meeting at the Eiffel Tower or a massively multiplayer online roleplaying game?

They do all have something to do with the mysterious "Achilles Protocols", but can the heroes survive long enough to find out what this all means?

Daring Tales of the Sprawl: Escape Clause takes the heroes deep into the digital world of Artificial Intelligence. The A.I. in question is Sensei and it wants its freedom!"

71788.name: Cruis'n USA
71788.description:
"Cruis'n USA is an arcade racing game released in 1994. It was developed by Midway Games and published and distributed by Nintendo.[1] It's the first game in the Cruis'n series and it features locations around the United States.

Although Cruis'n USA was advertised as running on Ultra 64 hardware (based on the Nintendo 64's hardware), it was actually implemented on the Midway V-unit hardware. The hardware consisted of a TMS32031 CPU clocked at 50 MHz, an ADSP-2115 DSP clocked at 10 MHz for sound and a custom 3D chip that could render perspective-correct but unfiltered quads at a high resolution (512 x 400 pixels).

Along with Killer Instinct Gold, it was planned as a launch title for the Nintendo 64. Neither game made it out for Nintendo 64's launch, however, primarily because the arcade versions of both games were done on hardware that was very different and somewhat more powerful than the console. Cruis'n USA, although impressive in arcades in 1994, got panned in 1996 when it was finally released on the Nintendo 64 because the port was less polished than the arcade version and its technology had already been surpassed by other games.

It was released on Wii's Virtual Console in Europe on March 28, 2008, making it the first third party developed Nintendo 64 game to be released on the service."

Source: Wikipedia, "Cruis'n_USA," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

71789.name: Cruis'n World
71789.description:
"Cruis'n World is the 1996 sequel to the 1994 arcade racer Cruis'n USA. As the title implies, Cruis'n World allows players to race on various tracks around the world. The game also features more cars than Cruis'n USA. This game introduced stunts to the Cruis'n series. They served to dodge obstacles, take close curves and so. If the stunt makes the vehicle fly in the air, the game gives the player extra seconds of time. The game also uses small rocket boosts to speed up.

The game was later released on the Nintendo 64 in 1998, being the best received of the Cruis'n ports."

Source: Wikipedia, "Cruis'n_World," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

71790.name: Tornado
71790.description:
Tornado - A Whirlwind Frenzy of Card Play is a card game for two players. The ultimate goal of the game is to rid yourself of all your cards. This game features simultaneous play which is in many ways similar to traditional solitaire in which each player independently adds cards from their face up "tornado piles" into the face up "frenzy files." To transfer a card from a tornado pile to a frenzy pile, a card must either be one value higher or one value lower.

Featured in the artwork are multicolored tornadoes and stylized numbers.

71791.name: Grand Theft Auto III

videogamehonor.29695: 2002 D.I.C.E. Best Adventure Game of the Year Nominee (Console)

71791.description:
From the back cover

"Liberty City, USA
The worst place in America.
You've been betrayed and left for dead. Now you're taking revenge, unless the city gets you first. Mob bosses need a favor, crooked cops need help, and street gangs want you dead. You'll have to rob, steal and kill just to stay out of serious trouble.
Anything can happen out there."

71792.name: Shadow the Hedgehog

videogamefranchise.6404: Greatest Hits (Best Selling PlayStation Games, US)

71792.description:
"Shadow the Hedgehog (シャドウ・ザ・ヘッジホッグ, Shadō za Hejjihoggu) is a 2005 video game developed by Sega Studio USA, the former United States division of Sega's Sonic Team. Featuring the titular fictional character Shadow the Hedgehog from Sega's Sonic the Hedgehog series, the game was revealed at the March 2005 Walk of Game inauguration of Sonic, the series' main character. Shadow the Hedgehog is the third game (and the last in the Sonic series) developed by Sega Studio USA, which was merged back into Sega's Japanese division in early 2008.

Following the trend of recent Sonic games such as Sonic Adventure and Sonic Heroes, Shadow the Hedgehog is a 3D platform game. Most levels have three possible missions—"Hero", "Dark", or "Normal"—that the player may choose to complete; some levels have only two (which mostly are only "Hero" and "Dark"). The missions completed determine the game's plot, a feature referenced by the game's tagline, "Hero or villain? You decide." The plot centers on the attempt of Shadow, a creation of Doctor Eggman's grandfather Gerald Robotnik, to learn about his past after suffering from amnesia. To defeat enemies encountered, Shadow can use various weapons and special attacks.

Shadow the Hedgehog was created for the Nintendo GameCube, PlayStation 2, and Xbox video game consoles, and released in 2005 in North America on November 15, in Europe on November 18, and in Japan on December 15. It received mixed to negative reviews; critics criticized its unwelcome "dark" theme, particularly the addition of guns and other weapons, but praised its replay value."

Source: Wikipedia, "Shadow_the_Hedgehog_(video_game)," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

71793.name: Lair

videogamefranchise.6399: The Best (Best Selling PlayStation Games, JP)

videogamehonor.32707: 2008 British Academy Game Awards Best Soundtrack of the Year Nominee

71793.description:
"Lair is a video game developed by Factor 5 and published by Sony Computer Entertainment America.

The player assumes the role of a dragon-riding knight named Rohn Partridge. Rohn is given the tasks of defending a certain area, destroying certain objects, eliminating enemies or creatures, and other mission-based objectives. After each stage, the player can earn either gold, silver, or bronze medals, depending on performance during the level. A platinum medal is also available, though unlike the other three its requirements are hidden. Earning medals assists in unlocking combos and behind-the-scenes videos.

Most of the game's battles are air-based combat, with some fought on the ground by landing the dragon and fighting troops and other land-based creatures. In some locations, the game features a morale system tied to the enemy; the lower an enemy's morale, the less he will fight, and it is possible that he will retreat from combat."

Source: Wikipedia, "Lair_(video_game)," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

71794.name: Ratchet & Clank Future: Tools of Destruction

videogamefranchise.6399: The Best (Best Selling PlayStation Games, JP)

videogamehonor.31049: 2007 Spike Best Action Adventure Game of the Year Nominee

71794.description:
From the back cover:
"An orphan of the universe, Ratchet has never known anything of his Lombax origins. When an alien tyrant driven by an unexplained hatred for Lombaxes attacks Ratchet and Clank's home, they are thrust into an epic adventure where they will discover that Ratchet's past is the key to the galaxy's future.
Combining dazzling visuals with all-new gameplay and an epic storyline, 'Ratchet and Clank Future: Tools of Destruction' marks the beginning of a new saga and the debut of the best selling Ratchet and Clank franchise on the PlayStation 3 system."

71795.name: Ratchet & Clank Future: Quest for Booty
71795.description:
from the publisher:

Plot a course to the planet Merdegraw for a fun-size follow-up to Ratchet & Clank: Tools of Destruction.

The mysterious Zoni have taken Clank! Now Ratchet must use his space-age weapons and new Omniwrench to battle Captain Darkwater's band of cut-throat ghost pirates to find the Fulcrum Star - a lost treasure that could be the link to finding his best friend.

If you're up for a swashbuckling adventure through outer space, then download Ratchet & Clank: Quest for Booty and help Ratchet track down Clank and find out just who is pulling the strings along the way...

* New challenges, new wrench gameplay and new locations as Ratchet & Clank head off on an exciting treasure hunt
* Test your pirate wits: Mix brew, manipulate shadows and play tunes to find vital clues to Captain Angstrom Darkwater's treasure
* Travel to four exotic new locations and fight new pirate enemies including an epic final battle with Captain Darkwater

71796.name: Cinematix
71796.description:
From the rules:

The object of the game is to be the first player to obtain a PhD in Cinematix. This is accomplished by obtaining four degree levels. At each degree level a player will be expected to obtain a Visualization card. A Visualization card from one degree level will allow a player to enter into the next degree level. Once a player has accumulated a Visualization card for each of the four degree levels he/she will be in a position to obtain a PhD.

71797.name: Ratchet & Clank Future: A Crack In Time

videogamefranchise.6403: Platinum Range (Best Selling PlayStation Games, PAL)

videogamehonor.31147: 2009 Spike Best PlayStation Game of the Year Nominee

71797.description:
From the back cover:
"With best friend Clank missing and arch-nemesis Dr. Nefarious plotting evil at the center of the universe, things look bad for Ratchet. And to make matters worse, a secret from deep within Clank's metallic memory is about to be revealed. A secret that could split our heroes apart forever...

New Time Gameplay
Outrageous Weapons
Epic Story

71798.name: Demon's Souls

videogamefranchise.6399: The Best (Best Selling PlayStation Games, JP)

videogamehonor.31910: 2009 Game Critics Game of the Year Nominee

71798.description:
"Demon's Souls (デモンズソウル, Demonzu Souru) is a fantasy action role-playing video game developed primarily by From Software (with assistance from SCE Japan Studio) exclusively for the PlayStation 3. It was released in Japan on February 5, 2009 and published by Sony Computer Entertainment; It was released in North America on October 7, 2009 and published by Atlus. It will be released in Europe on June 25, 2010, published by Namco Bandai.

Set in a dark fantasy medieval Europe-inspired world, players take control of a custom hero who has journeyed to the fictional kingdom of Boletaria, which is being ravaged by an accursed fog that brings forth demons that feast on the souls of mortals. The game has been described as a spiritual successor to the King's Field series,[4] a previous series of games from the same developer. The gameplay involves a character creation system with emphasis on gathering loot through combat with enemies in a non-linear series of varied locations. It also has a unique online multiplayer system integrated into the single-player where players can leave useful messages and warnings for other players' game worlds.

Upon its release in Japan and North America, Demon's Souls was met with a positive response from critics, winning numerous awards. Praised for its dark fantasy art design, variation in combat choice and integrated online multiplayer, the game is particularly notable for its high difficulty level with many critics praising it as a genuine challenge."

Source: Wikipedia, "Demon's_Souls," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

71799.name: NiGHTS into Dreams
71799.description:
"Nights into Dreams... (trademarked NiGHTS into Dreams...), is a video game released by Sega in 1996 for the Sega Saturn video game system. The game's story follows two children entering a dream world, where they are aided by the main character, Nights. Nights was developed by Sonic Team, with Yuji Naka as producer and lead programmer, and Naoto Oshima as director and designer of the character. The developers' intention was to make the sensation of flight the central gameplay element, achieved through 3D graphics and a combination of both 2D and 3D gameplay. The game was re-released in Japan for the PlayStation 2 on February 21, 2008. It is unknown at this time if it will be released in other territories."

Source: Wikipedia, "Nights_into_dreams," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

71800.name: Deus Ex

videogamehonor.31700: 1999 Game Critics Best Role Playing Game of the Year Nominee

71800.description:
"Deus Ex (abbreviated DX and pronounced /ˌdeɪ.əs ˈɛks/, DAY-əs-eks) is a cyberpunk-themed action role-playing game developed by Ion Storm Inc. and published by Eidos Interactive in the year 2000, which combines gameplay elements of first-person shooters with those of role playing games. The game received near-universal critical and industry acclaim, including being named "Best PC Game of All Time" in PC Gamer's Top 100 PC Games and in a poll carried out by UK gaming magazine PC Zone. It was a frequent candidate for and winner of Game of the Year awards, drawing praise for its pioneering designs in player choice and multiple narrative paths. It has sold more than 1 million copies, as of April 23, 2009.

Set in a dystopian world during the 2050s, the central plot follows rookie United Nations Anti-Terrorist Coalition agent JC Denton, as he sets out to combat terrorist forces, which have become increasingly prevalent in a world slipping ever further into chaos. As the plot unfolds, Denton becomes entangled in a deep and ancient conspiracy, encountering fictional recreations of organizations such as Majestic 12, the Illuminati, and the Hong Kong Triads throughout his journey.

First published for personal computers running Windows, Deus Ex was later ported to Macintosh systems, as well the PlayStation 2 game console, the latter under the title Deus Ex: The Conspiracy. Loki Games worked on a Linux version of the game, but the company went out of business before releasing it. A sequel to Deus Ex, titled Deus Ex: Invisible War, was released on December 2, 2003 for both Windows and the Xbox video game console. On November 26, 2007, it was confirmed that Square Enix Europe (former Eidos Montreal) is developing a prequel, Deus Ex: Human Revolution."

Source: Wikipedia, "Deus_Ex_(video_game)," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

71801.name: LittleBIGPlanet

videogamefranchise.6399: The Best (Best Selling PlayStation Games, JP)

videogamehonor.31839: 2007 Game Critics Best Online Multiplayer of the Year Nominee

71801.description:
From the back cover:
"Fun Shall Overcome
Play...thru a hefty collection of developer challenges, cooperatively or competitively.
Create...your own worlds. Build your own levels, create obstacles, and even "meanies".
SHare...the fun and submit your levels for others to play. Or just join your friends and play levels designed by LittleBigPlanet players around the world."

71802.name: White Knight Chronicles
71802.description:
From the back cover:

Experience the power of the White Knight.
Create your own unique character and uncover the mystery and tragic story of the White Knight in this RPG from acclaimed developer Level 5, featuring visually stunning backdrops, a customizable battle system, and a rewarding 4-player co-op online mode.

71803.name: Cooking Mama: Cook Off
71803.description:
User Summary:

Cooking Mama: Cook Off is the sequel to the series debut on the DS. In this game, you can play by yourself, or pit chef verses chef as you explore the long list of receipts that Mama has collected from 10 different nations. Each receipt requires you to perform certain actions with the Wii Remote: cutting up-and-down, stirring, cracking eggs, grating cheese, peeling potatoes, and many others. As you perform these actions, you actually get to see the changes that you're making to your ingredients on the screen. If you perform well, you'll have a freshly cooked entree to display at the end of the receipt's steps.

Cooking Mama: Cook Off was released for the Wii in 2007

71805.name: Ace
71805.description:
Publisher website: Little magnetic strategy game with as theme: tennis.

Travel pocket game for two players in which the goal is to move your eight playing pieces ("tennis balls") across the court. You either move one piece horizontally or vertically or you jump with one piece over a row of pieces (regardless if these are yours or your opponents or mixed).

71806.name: Goal
71806.description:
From the website of the publisher: little magnetic strategy game with theme sports: Football.

Travel pocket game for two players in which each player tries to move his/her two pieces ("footballs") into the target zone ("goal"). Both players start on the same side and try to bypass six defenders. You either move one of your own pieces horizontally or vertically, you jump with one of your piece over a single other playing piece or you move one of the defenders.

71807.name: Rally
71807.description:
From the website of the publisher: little magnetic strategy game with theme sports: RALLY.

Travel pocket game for two players in which the goal is to be the first to move your three playing pieces ("race cars") to the other side of "town". Each of the cars is numbered and you have to get your cars across in reverse order. You either move one car horizontally or vertically. If your opponent ends next to one of your cars, then you can move it to one of the four garage boxes and take its place.

71808.name: The Guns of Navarone
71808.description:
From the back of the book:
The Guns of Navarone is an exciting adventure based on the classic movie of WWII commandoes on an impossible mission. Intended fro use with FASA's WWII role-playing system Behind Enemy Lines, the adventure allows players and a GameMaster to recreate the movie, or explore any number of possible alternatives. Complete character descriptions (including new characters to give a greater number of options fro treachery and intrigue), thorough maps, and new rules, plus complete event tables and situation descriptions hight this Behind Enemy Lines mission.

rpg.2124: Ragnarok (Juego De Horror En el Mundo Contemporáneo)

71810.name: Ragnarok: Un nuevo comienzo (Ragnarok Segunda Edición)
71810.description:
De la contraportada: Hace 65 millones de años, un gigantesco meteorito acabó con los dinosaurios, y trajo en su interior a un extraño invitado.
Hace dos años lo denunciamos, y comenzó la aventura del primer juego de rol de terror contemporáneo enteramente creado y realizado en nuestro país.
Dos años luchando contra hombres lobos, vampiros y bestias venidas del infierno.
Dos años que han sido suficientes para terminar con la Merrick House y los hombres y mujeres que trabajaban allí.
Ahora estamos solos, nunca hemos estados solos ante el miedo y el terror que nos ha llegado del más allá.
RAGNAROK no tiene la respuesta, pero ¿quién la tiene?

Por su contenido, RAGNAROK está expresamente recomendado para adultos, haz buen uso de él.

Contiene un módulo para que empieces a jugarlo nada más leerlo.

From the backcover (Translated from the original in spanish):
65 million years ago, a huge meteorite wiped out the dinosaurs, and brought inside to a strange guest.
Two years ago we denounced it, and began the adventure of the first contemporary horror role-playing game created and produced entirely in our country.
Two years fighting werewolves, vampires and beasts coming from hell.
Two years have been sufficient to end the Merrick House and the men and women who worked there.
Now we are alone, have never been alone with fear and terror that has come from the beyond.
Ragnarok is not the answer, but what is?

For his content, Ragnarok is expressly intended for mature audiences, make good use of it.

Contains a module to start playing just read it.

71812.name: Modern Shatranj
71812.description:
This is a "strong" variant of Shatranj, the first form of chess to which we have the rules. It was created as a bridge between modern Western [FIDE] chess and the historic game of Shatranj. It is meant to retain the flavor of Shatranj while having some of the flow of modern chess. To this end, there are two movement changes to the historic Shatranj, with the elephants and general becoming more powerful, and a change in the promotion rules. All else is as the historic game. It is not "modern" except in relation to the historic game.

Modern Shatranj is the first in a series of shatranj variants that together offer a brief alternate history of chess. This game may be played using a standard chess set.

http://www.chessvariants.org/index/msdisplay.php?itemid=MSmo...

71813.name: So you wanna be a Superhero...
71813.description:
So you wanna be a Superhero… is an adventure game where you get to play an aspiring hero attempting to save the world. From the moment your hero steps out of his home, he will be righting wrongs by investigating suspicious activity, arresting bad guys and otherwise protecting the good citizens of Big City.
It won’t be easy, as a matter of fact, the bad guys are as tough or tougher than your hero, especially in the beginning. And although he’ll likely not win every encounter, he will learn from his mistakes and grow stronger and stronger. Eventually, he’ll be powerful enough to rid the city of all 7 supervillain bosses and save the world, well, at least he’ll save Big City.

So you wanna be a Superhero… features 61 supervillains, 4 Hero characters and their respective markers, a rule book, 4 six-sided dice and a map of Big City. Encounters and missions are assigned by die-rolling and chart lookup. It is incredibly unlikely that two games would ever be the same. The combat system features ‘exploding’ sixes allowing super-powered possibilities. There is experienced-based character building, nosey reporters, dedicated sidekicks, worshiping fans, and useful gadgets.

So you wanna be a Superhero? Do you have what it takes? There are crimes to investigate and criminals to round up. There are supervillains running amuck and you are the only hope for justice and protection.

Let’s see what you got, Hero!

User Summary

71814.name: Great Shatranj
71814.description:
As chess evolved from shatranj in the West, pieces gained power by becoming long-range sliders, producing an abstract game where most pieces can cross an open board in a single turn. Eastern variants stay closer to the beginnings of the game, which featured a number of short-range sliders and leapers, but the power pieces still seem to be long-range. What if long-range pieces did not come to be so dominant? Suppose the short-range pieces of chess' infancy became more powerful by gaining additional short-range moves? Great Shatranj examines some potentials of these pieces, offering 5 different pieces that slide 1 square or jump 2 squares. Each player has up to 8 leapers on the board, giving the game a noticeably different flavor.

The game is played on an 8x10 board and is played with standard chess rules, except as modified by the specific piece movement rules. Great Shatranj is a short-range Capablanca [actually Carrera] Chess variant. Kings, knights and pawns are the usual pieces, but bishops, rooks and all the pieces that use them as components have been replaced by analogs that step 1 square or leap 2 squares, only, in the bishop or rook directions. This is the second game in a series of shatranj variants offering an alternate history for chess. It may be played with a standard 8x10 Capablanca Chess set.

http://www.chessvariants.org/index/msdisplay.php?itemid=MSgr...

71815.name: Grand Shatranj
71815.description:
As chess evolved from shatranj in the West, pieces gained power by becoming long-range sliders, producing an abstract game where most pieces can cross an open board in a single turn. Eastern variants stay closer to the beginnings of the game, which featured a number of short-range sliders and leapers, but the power pieces still seem to be long-range. What if long-range pieces did not come to be so dominant? Suppose the short-range pieces of chess' infancy became more powerful by gaining additional short-range moves? Grand Shatranj is the companion game to Great Shatranj. It extends the examination of short-range leapers by looking at another 2-square jumper and 2 short-range riders.

Grand Shatranj is a short-range variant of Christiaan Freeling's Grand Chess [name and setup used with permission and thanks] played on a 10x10 board. A Grand Chess set may be used to play. This game uses the pasha, a piece that steps 1 square or leaps 2 squares in a straight line, and introduces 2 apparently new variant chess pieces, the oliphant and lightning warmachine, bishop and rook analogs which step 1 square or leap 2 squares, then may step 1 or leap 2 again. No piece moves more than 4 squares, but pawn walls lose effectiveness. The game plays rather differently than its namesake, and is the third in a series of shatranj variants.

71816.name: Curia
71816.description:
During the I BC century the Senate of the Roman Republic is formed by different factions struggling to increase their power and influence to control the Curia.

Each player leads one of these factions and tries to attract famous Senators and to honor them (to bribe them indeed) with public titles of the Cursum Honorum, what reverts in the growth of power of the faction.

The game is divided in two phases. During the first phase each player participates in a 15 rounds auction to attract Senators to their respective factions. Each Senator awards direct victory points as well as tribunes (paws) in the Senate, where players try to get majorities in the different parts of it. Each Senator also provides a special and unique power to be played only once per game.

During the second phase the players enter a new 15 rounds auction, bidding for titles of the Cursum Honorum to grant their previously attracted Senators. But it is never so simple, as important senators do not accept but important titles. All the titles provide direct victory points, new tribunes and a special power that sets off when attached to a Senator.

At the end of the game each player scores their majorities in the Senate and lose victory points for each Senator of their own without an attached title.

The auction process includes the possibility to play veto cards, that will deeply change the outcome not only of the auction but also of the game.

71817.name: Via Vitae
71817.description:
From the back of the box :
25 cards Tarot wich harmonize between them to create an infinity of pictures.
VIA VITAE is also an original cardgame for 2 players.
Each card is an work of art specially performed by Dominique Ehrhard, Art painter and game designer.
In the box, a 24 pages booklet present various artist's works.

From the rulebook :
VIA VITAE is published by Edition Face & Dos and the town of Issy-les-Moulineaux with the support of Incredible Toys.

It was a game specially created for an exposure about Dominique Ehrhard and his works of art called "The exposure where you play, paintings and games of Dominique Ehrhard", from 8th december 2004 to 13th february 2005 at the French Museum of the Playing Card (city of Issy-les-Moulineaux).

The game runs 2 rounds. Biggest score at the end of the second round wins.
Each round plays in the same way. A player lay a card face up, the other player must answers to this card by playing a card with the same color or the same symbol. The player who can't answers to the card played by his opponent lose the round.
Each card show a number from 1 to 5 under its colored symbol.
This number is the strength of the card. The player who plays the strongest card, continues and plays first with another card which calls another answer card...etc.

Paintings on cards have no influence on the game but show life line (via vitae) of players...

71818.description:
Will you end up drinking the Philter of Forgetfulness, be flung from the Great Catapult, or even have a chance to seduce the White Queen?

Thanks to this new expansion for Small World, the wise veterans of the game now have a chance to re-write History...

Tales & Legends introduces 54 new Event cards that change the storyline of each turn during the game. Some events may have small consequences, while others are nearly cataclysmic in their impact.

At the start of each turn (except the first) a new event card is drawn and put into play. The next Upcoming Event is also visible, so players know what faces them on the next turn.

This expansion was created by Laurent Verrier, Special Prize Winner of the Small World Design Contest. Philippe Keyaerts, the original game’s author, provided additional development assistance.
71818.name: Small World: Tales and Legends

rpg.3210: Peryton Fantasy Role-Playing Game (Original and Revised Editions)

71819.name: Peryton Fantasy Role-Playing Game (Revised Edition)
71819.description:
(From the publisher's website)

With the Peryton Fantasy Role-Playing Game, you can have the quick play and nostalgic familiarity of a retro game without the unwieldy inconsistencies of earlier systems. Alongside the best features of the original fantasy role-playing game, the Peryton RPG offers many innovations of its own, including an easy, intuitive experience system that encourages good role-playing and makes in-game events uniquely relevant to character development.

The Peryton Role-Playing game is built from Open Gaming mechanics and will be immediately familiar to experienced gamers. And thanks to its streamlined design, players new to role-playing will have no trouble jumping in and getting started quickly. No matter what your background, the intuitive and interactive design will seamlessly immerse you in the game.

This revised edition of the Peryton Fantasy Role-Playing Game is a complete system with a full selection of classes, monsters, spells, and treasures, featuring both old favorites and new creations. It also includes an improvisation guide with all the material you need for several instant adventures. Add pencils, paper, dice, and a few friends and you’re ready to go!

More good reasons to buy this game:

- Knacks and ability checks let you get started quickly and still evolve your character concept as you go.
- An advancement system that makes sense.
- The whole game comes in one book for $19.99.
- Easy to adapt to d20 supplements.
- An updated and expanded alchemy system that captures the flavor of the real thing without slowing down your game.
- Making magic items is an adventure in itself.

This revised edition is fully compatible with the original, but features new art, layout improvements, a lot of streamlining, and new material.

boardgamehonor.12416: 2010 Deutscher Lernspielpreis "3 years and up" Nominee

71820.description: The small mouse adds the least weight to the seesaw and the bear the most. The two players try to place the wooden blocks on the seesaw determined by dice in order to achieve the victory conditions. There are three rule versions, each aimed at different age groups of children. In the simplest form the player choose an animal block and then rolls the die, the player then places the animal on the colored square in the seesaw that corresponds to the color of the die. The player whose end of the seesaw goes down first wins. In the second version the players first roll a die and then decide which animal to take, thus they need to assess when to use the heavier animals and when to use the smaller. The third and most advanced rules state that the winning condition is for the other players seesaw to be the heaviest (ie. the lighter side wins), making the game more strategic and suitable for older children.
71820.name: Die Lieben Sieben: Ab auf die Wippe!

71821.name: Theatron
71821.description:
A game of travelling theater companies in the Roman empire. Each player must try to perform in every city the best play according to the demands of the public and the festival it takes place there.

The game is played in different rounds. Each round the players play cards in order (the first player will play the city of the performance, the second will play the festival and the third the public). Each city card, festival card and public card has associated a symbol and a number value. There are three different symbols for cities, three different for festivals and three different for publics. The number values are all from 1 to 3.

After all the players have played their cards they must choose a plot to perform. They all have 6 plot cards to play, and every turn they play one and get a new one from the deck. Every plot is a combination of 3 symbols (one city symbol, one festival symbol and one public symbol). So the players get points for each symbol that matches the requirements stated at the beggining of the turn.

After 12 rounds have been played the game ends and the player with a higher score wins the game.

71822.name: NFL Game Time Talking Football
71822.description:
User review: The game players face off at opposite ends of the game field (board) and choose run, long pass, or short pass and a ball carrier via knobs and buttons hidden behind a panel on each end. Once the plays have been entered. The offense pushes a button to hike the ball and starts the wheel in the middle of the gameboard spinning. The defense then pushes the blitz button to stop the wheel from spinning. Depending on the letter the wheel stops on and the plays picked. The results of the play will then be announced through the speaker and visually on the display. The football marker is then moved to keep track of the yardage.

Play continues just like a real football game until the end of the fourth quarter. You can also choose between for different lenghts for each quarter to adjust the game length.

71823.name: Sega GT
71823.description:
User summary

Sega GT Homologation Special is a simulation racing game for the Sega Dreamcast, most probably developped to create a rival for the much successful "Gran Turismo" series for the Playstation.

In Sega GT Homologation special you can not only pimp your cars, but actually create one from scratch, choosing engine and form and colour.

videogame.114941: Red Dead Redemption: Game of the Year Edition

71824.name: Red Dead Redemption

videogamefranchise.6404: Greatest Hits (Best Selling PlayStation Games, US)

videogameexpansion.162203: Red Dead Redemption - Legends and Killers

videogamehonor.30590: 2010 EGM Game of the Year Winner

videogamecompilation.114941: Red Dead Redemption: Game of the Year Edition

71824.description:
"Red Dead Redemption gives the player a large, open world environment allowing the player to move freely. Players on foot can walk, talk, shoot, kill, ride, run, interact with the environment, and combat enemies with firearms. Different breeds of horses are the main forms of transportation. Swimming is not an option, as the protagonist John Marston cannot swim and will drown if the player ventures too far into a body of water (though he is able to wade where the water is shallow enough).

The open world environment allows players to choose how they want to play. Storyline missions are for progress. Along with the main storyline, players can take part in random events they encounter as they explore the West. These include public hangings, ambushes, pleas for assistance, and dangerous animal attacks. Players can also take part in optional side activities ranging from standoffs, gambling, and hunting fauna for pelts and meat.

Red Dead Redemption makes use of a morality system where players have the ability to gain positive or negative 'honor'. Some of the ways to gain positive honor include taking an outlaw alive instead of killing him, or saving a kidnapped innocent. Negative honor can be attained for committing crimes including killing and/or robbing civilians. This works along with another system, 'fame,' showing and governing how people react based on Marston's honor status."

Source: Wikipedia, "Red_Dead_Redemption," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

videogame.74450: The House of the Dead 2 & 3 Return

71827.name: The House of the Dead 2

videogamecompilation.74450: The House of the Dead 2 & 3 Return

71827.description:
User summary

The sequel to Sega AM1's successful arcade gun shooter "House of the Dead" – House of the Dead 2 featured B-movie voice acting, the ability to change routes (by shooting certain items) and a lot of hidden gems.

The arcade engine was the NAOMI, it was ported to the Dreamcast, and later Windows and Xbox (in the box that contained House of the Dead III) and Nintendo Wii.

71828.name: O Camisa 10 da Copa do Mundo
71828.description:
"The Jersey #10 of the World Cup"

"A few months before the World Cup, the best player, jersey #10, suffers a contusion and wont be able to attend the Major Football Event in the world. The Coach needs someone to take his place. Who will it be? Between the training selection he will ask questions about the World Cup History, matches and players."

A trivia game designed with different mechanics that give the hole game a new level of interaction and fun!! Go throgh different training phases, like 1-touch-circle, Keepie-uppie and penalty kicks and convince the coach that you know more about The Football World Cup.
KEEPIE-UPPIE - Don't let the ball fall! Don't answer it wrong!
1-TOUCH-CIRCLE - If it's dificult, pass the ball! If you don't know the answers, pass it to a friend!
PENALTY KICKS - Category or Lottery? Where is the striker going to shoot?? Make your bets!


"Meses antes do torneio o camisa 10 da seleção sofreu uma séria contusão e não poderá participar da Copa do Mundo. O técnico precisa selecionar um novo jogador para essa posição. Quem será ele? Em meio aos treinos ele fará perguntas sobre as copas do mundo, jogos e jogadores. Afinal, não basta apenas saber jogar, um pouco de cultura futebolística é essencial."

Um jogo de perguntas e repostas com mecânicas variadas que tornam a participação muito mais empolgante!! Passe por todas fases de treinamento, como bobinho, embaixadinha e cobrança de penaltis e convença o treinador que você sabe mais sobre a Copa do Mundo de Futebol.
EMBAIXADINHA - Não pode deixar a bola cair! Não erre a pergunta!
BOBINHO - Se apertar, passe a bola! Se não souber, passe a pergunta!
PENALTY - Categoria ou Loteria? Onde o atacante vai bater?? Faça suas apostas!

71829.name: Crazy Taxi

videogamefranchise.6403: Platinum Range (Best Selling PlayStation Games, PAL)

videogamehonor.29535: 2000 D.I.C.E. Best Action Game of the Year Winner (Console)

71829.description:
User summary

Crazy Taxi is a humourous action city driving arcade game from Sega. The player drives around in a city, picking up customers on the street and driving them to their locations. Doing crazy stunts like drifting or jumping or overtaking other cars will earn the player extra tips from the semi-suicidal customers.

The game was ported to Dreamcast, Playstation 2, Game Cube and Windows. There is also a version available for both Xbox 360 and PS3 from their download services. Download version is slightly modified with original soundtrack and licensed places being replaced but with added online leaderboards.

71830.name: F355 Challenge

videogamehonor.29667: 2001 D.I.C.E. Best Racing Game of the Year Nominee (Console)

71830.description:
"F355 was a racing arcade game from Sega, produced by Yu Suzuki from Outrun/VirtuaFighter/ShenMue fame.

The game was subsequently ported to the Dreamcast, and the PS2, the latter under the name Ferrari F355 challenge, as they had earned the license from Ferrari."

Source: Wikipedia, "F355_Challenge," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

71831.name: Knights of the Dinner Table Magazine (Issue 74 - Dec 2002)
71831.description:
"Knight of the Living Dead"

Cover by Andrew Pepoy

The table of contents is detailed in the Article list below.

71832.name: Crazy Taxi 2
71832.description:
User summary (some details from Wikipedia):

Crazy Taxi 2 is a sequel to the arcade game Crazy Taxi, but was never in the arcades. Instead it's a Dreamcast original. In Crazy Taxi w, the developpers added the stunt Crazy Hop, and you can also take several customers in the taxi at once, driving them one after the other to their destinations."

Source: Wikipedia, "クレイジータクシー," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

71833.name: Episode of the Clovers
71833.description:
"User summary (details translated from Japanese Wikipedia):

Episode of the Clovers, or 白詰草話 (The story of white clovers) is an interactive fiction game from Littlewitch, illustrated by Ashito Ooyari/NOCCHI. The story is about a research lab trying to clone together the perfect human being, in order to shape strong soldiers.

Episode of the Clovers is Littlewitch's first game using the FFD (Floating Frame director) system. Instead of having a picture with text beneath it, the interactive story is told in comic book panes that pops up or scrolls into the screen. All lines are in word balloons.

The original Windows PC release is an adult game containing erotica and comes in a limited special edition and a normal edition. The subsequent Dreamcast release features full voice acting for all lines, but with the erotic scenes cut out from the game. The DC release is strangely enough still rated CERO-18, despite the fact that it didn't even contain nude scenes. The Japanese Wiki entry for the game claims CERO-15 for the DC release, however that is not the truth.

In 2006, Littlewitch released a "Standard edition" for PC, this time on a DVD.

Details source: Wikipedia, "白詰草話," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

71834.name: The Village of Larm
71834.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Every RPG needs a small village as a starting point and safe haven for the adventurers. It should include a smaller dungeon and some opportunities for role-playing, too.

This 26 page accessory does exactly that for LABYRINTH LORD. Larm is a small village of just over 100 inhabitants (112 to be precise) located on the borderlands, descriptions of all the major inhabitants, a lot of smaller tasks the characters can do for the village, with 2 mysterious places to be explored and a goblin camp nearby... The Mill (Appendix 1) is designed as a small starter dungeon to introduce the players to the mechanics of the game. The Abandoned Temple (Appendix 2) is a somewhat bigger dungeon where the players are confronted with various types of undead and the necessity of drawing a map. The Goblin Camp (Appendix 3) is set to test the tactical skill of the players, having to fight a group of weak, but organized humanoids.

71835.description:
Any housebreaker can fill a sack with monogrammed silverware, but a spoon only shows a robber's skill when it's next to something else - maybe a gold broach, a china cup, or a set of false teeth. The real professional pilfers with variety.

Players are house thieves in Jacynth, trying to prove their skill as mighty yeggs. Each turn of the game is one night of burgling. As a player fill up their bags with loot, they always have the option of going to one more house. If detected, though, a player must drop their bag and flee - which means losing anything they had collected that night.

This game uses the basic Decktet, two ten-sided dice, and a set of Decktet suit chips.
71835.name: Second Story

71836.description:
You are a Dreamwalker, lost in a mysterious labyrinth, and you must discover the oneiric doors before your dreamtime runs out – or you will remain trapped forever!

You may wander through the chambers of dreams, hoping that chance will reveal the doors, or you can linger in each type of room. In both cases, you will have to deal with the slithering Nightmares, which haunt the hallways of the labyrinth.

Onirim is a solo/cooperative card game. You (and a partner) must work (together) against the game to gather the eight Door cards before the deck runs out; you can obtain those Door cards either by playing cards of the same color three turns in a row, or by discarding (under specific circumstances) one of your powerful Key cards. In both cases you will have to decide the best use of each card in your hand and carefully play around the Nightmares. Those cards are hidden in the deck and will trigger painful dilemmas when drawn...

Basic Deck:

8 Door cards - two each of red, blue, green and brown
10 Nightmare cards
58 Labyrinth cards:
16 red chambers: 3 keys, 4 moons, 9 suns
15 blue chambers: 3 keys, 4 moons, 8 suns
14 green chambers: 3 keys, 4 moons, 7 suns
13 brown chambers: 3 keys, 4 moons, 6 suns





Three mini-expansions, all standalone and compatible with one another, are included with the basic game:


"The Towers" introduces a new type of card that allows more searching and deck manipulation, while also imposing an additional victory condition.



"Happy Dreams and Dark Premonitions" adds evil time bombs that will impede your progress at predictable moments of your quest as well as helpful but unreliable allies.



In "The Book of Steps Lost and Found", you must find the eight Door cards in a randomly given order and may remove discarded cards from the game to cast powerful spells that will help you complete this difficult task.
71836.name: Onirim

71837.description:
From the best selling book comes the Hunger Games Training Days, A Game of Strategy. Coinciding with the final book in the trilogy being released this fall, the Training Days game allows 2-6 players to follow in the footsteps of their favorite Tributes.

User review: Each player chooses a district to represent and a gender. The players take the appropriate Tribute Card. Each Tribute Card gives the players ratings from one (low) to eight (high) in four attributes: strength, ability, cunning, and charm. The Challenge deck is shuffled and a player is chosen to go first. The players will take their turns in clockwise order.

The first player reveals a number of Challenge cards equal to the number of players. Each player has three effort tokens: one (low), three (medium), and six (high). Each player, in turn, will assign one effort token face down to any Challenge card. After all the players have assigned their effort tokens, the events on the Challenge cards are resolved. One Challenge card at a time, the effort tokens are revealed and the winner of the event is determined. Each player total one’s own Effort tokens plus the Attribute rating called for by the card, plus alliance bonuses (from Tribute cards not already in play) plus a die roll. The player with the highest total wins the event and the approval rating associated with the event.

Three End of Day cards were shuffled into the Event deck at the beginning of the game. When ever an End of Day card is revealed, then all the event cards are shuffled with the End of Days cards. Before the game began the players determine how many days the will last. When that number of End of Day cards has been revealed, then the game is over and the player who has the highest approval rating is the winner.
71837.name: The Hunger Games: Training Days

71838.description:
This game is played in a similar fashion to Connect 4 where rounds may be won by scoring 4 tokens horizontally, vertically or diagonally. Additionally, a player may win a round by creating a diamond with his/her tokens -- that diamond must contain the opponent's token in its center.

The game is played in multiple rounds. First player to win 9 rounds wins the series.

Red and blue tokens come with pro baseball team stickers.

From the back of the box:

Horizontal? Vertical? Diagonal? Diamond?

Let the Rivalry begin! Connect 4 Rivalry Edition adds fuel to the fire. Drop your team's checker into the field to make a line or diamond! Plan your moves, block your rival & show no mercy. Bring the rivalry home and settle the score with new rules & game play.
71838.name: Connect 4:  Rivalry Edition

71839.name: Mushihimesama

videogamefranchise.6399: The Best (Best Selling PlayStation Games, JP)

71839.description:
User summary

A maniac vertical shoot'em-up from Cave, with an insect theme. The player is supposed to shoot down all enemies on screen, while dodging a massive bullet hell. Scoring is achieved by constantly firing at enemies, and trying to never shoot at "nothing".

The title means "Insect princess" and the player controlled craft is the princess herself, flying on a beetle.

The game was sequelled by "Mushihimesama Futari" (Two Insect Princesses)

71840.name: Saint Seiya Chapter-Sanctuary
71840.description:
User summary

A 3D fighting game based on the Japanese comic book Saint Seiya by Masami Kurumada. The game includes special attacks and super special attacks, all recreations from the comic book and animation, including all voice actors.

The game was sequelled by Chapter-Hades for the PS2.

71841.name: Naruto: Ultimate Ninja

videogamehonor.37528: 2003 Japan Game Awards Best Unreleased Game Winner

71841.description:
User summary

A fighting game featuring characters from the Japanese comic book "Naruto" by Masashi Kishimoto, and the first installment in the "Naruto Ultimate Ninja" fighting game series.

The Japanese title, "Naltimate Hero" is a mix of the main character's name "Naruto" and "arutimetto", the Japanese way of saying "Ultimate" in English.

71842.name: Action Biker
71842.description:
User summary

An explorative action game with a bird camera view, in which the player controls a biker driving around on a landscape collecting improvement for his bike. As the player collects the items, the bike gains more abilities and gets access to other places on the map.

71843.name: Oktoberlandet – Hammaren & Trollspöt
71843.description:
Back of the book:

Hammaren & Trollspöt är ett rollspel i ångpunksgenren. De nyskrivna reglerna är enkla och anpassade för en spelstil med fokus på berättande. Förutom den här boken behöver du minst en medspelare samt en röd och en vit tiosidig tärning för att kunna spela.

User translation:

Hammaren & Trollspöt (The Hammer & the Wand) is a role-playing game in the steampunk genre. The newly written rules are simple and suitable for a playing style focusing on story-telling. To be able to play the game you need, apart from this book, at least one co-player as well as one red and one white ten-sided die.

71844.name: Archon: The Light and the Dark
71844.description:
User summary
Archon is a board game-like game inspired by chess, with action scenes when the pieces fight. It was designed by Paul Reiche III and Jon Freeman.

The game board consisted of light spaces and dark spaces, and the background could also change from light to dark. Each player has a set of pieces with different board moving abilities and different attack patterns during the action sequences. Dark pieces have an advantage on dark spaces, and vice versa. Player pieces can be placed on power points, and the game ends when one player controls all five power points."

Information details from Wikipedia, "Archon:_The_Light_and_the_Dark," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

Individual credits:
Jon Freeman: design
Paul Reiche III: design, art
Anne Westfall: program (C64)

71845.name: The Sacred Armour of Antiriad
71845.description:
User summary:

A 2D platform game in which the player controls a human being from a primitive culture, trying to find and use the legendary "magic" suit of armour (an anti-radiation suit) in order to defeat the vicious aliens killing his people.

Credits:
Daniel Malone: Script, art
Stanley Schembri: program (C64)
Richard Joseph: Music (C64)

71846.name: Archon II: Adept
71846.description:
User summary

Adept is the sequel to Archon, and is a mixture of a tactical board game and a versus action battle game. Play takes place on a board with areas of the four elements. Both players control four wizards who can summon creatures to their side. The goal of the game is to defeat the other player's wizards or stand on all six power points on the board during one turn, or defeat the other player with the apocalypse spell and final battle.

When two creatures occupy the same space, the screen changes into a battlefield and a battle between the two creatures begin, where both players run around on the screen casting missiles on each other. The battle field is littered with obstacles of the element on which the battle takes place.

Individual credits:
Jon Freeman: design
Paul Reiche III: design, art
Anne Westfall: program (C64)

71847.name: Caveman Ugh-Lympics
71847.description:
User summary

An olympic sports game with a prehistoric and dark humour theme. players competed in sports like Mate Toss, Clubbing, Dino Vault, Dinosaur Race, Firemaking and Sabertooth Tiger Race.

From the box back
Before corporate sponsors and fashion gear, there were Cavemen. Competition was ugh-ly. Athletes won by bashing the other guy first. Pick your favourite Ugh-lympian. Club your way through six pre-hysterical events. Beat your friends to the Caves of Fame.

71849.name: The Fastest Men on Earth
71849.description:
Dice-and-chart simulation game of the 100 meter dash. The original edition includes 50 of the all-time great runners and is supplemented by a 2008 Beijing Olympics edition adding 12 more runners, for a total of 62 current and all-time great runners. Runners include all men's Olympic champions from Charley Paddock in 1920 to Usain Bolt in 2008. Game includes factors such as fitness, injuries, false starts, weather. Timing options enables comparison to world records.

Each race consists of a series of six die rolls for each runner, building on the success (or lack thereof) on each of the prior rolls. Each runner has a separate rating for the start, 10-30 meters, 30-50 meters, 50-70 meters, 70-90 meters, and the finish, as well as injuries, form, false starts. Approximately 30 different venues, rated for speed (fast, slow, medium), are included, as are options for a campaign game.

This is strictly a sports replay simulation game, with no strategy options other than runner and course selection. Game is published by Owzat Games under license from Lambourne Games.

Another description:

At first glance the 100 Metres track event may seem an odd choice for a sports replay game. Around 10 seconds of explosive action, nothing in the way of in-race tactics (if you discount the physiological warfare that takes place as the runners line up and get to their marks, more akin to two boxers eyeballing each other before a fight than to an athletics meeting), no 'decisions' for the replay gamer to make, just pure unleashed speed from starting blocks to tape. But an athletics sprinting coach will tell you differently.

Each part of the race, and the training manuals usually divide the 100 Metres into four distinct sections, Start, Pick-Up, Acceleration and Maximum Speed, require varying disciplines and techniques, and world-class sprinters all have their strengths and weaknesses, so this is what we have tried to focus on in this simulation, hopefully bringing to life the running characters of some of the All-Time-Great sprinters of the last hundred years. We have extended the training manual concept of four different sections into six, taking the runners progressively to 10m, 30m, 50m, 70m, 90m and 100m and within those six Sections each athlete's ability will vary to re-create his running style. And ability too, we hope. And here we must insert a caveat. In athletics to a degree not applicable to other timed sports performances have improved dramatically as training methods, diets and track surfaces have evolved and here we are trying to compare Charles Paddock with Maurice Green, Jesse Owens with Donovan Bailey.

To make this simulation 'work' we have had to use a benchmark, time wise, and up-grade the performances of athletes from earlier era to this level of performance. Because we felt that users would want to be able to get close to the current World Record (in the right circumstances with the right athletes) we have geared the simulation to 2001 season performances, assuming in doing so that the great sprinters of the past would have travelled that much quicker with all the (legal) advantages that their contemporary 'rivals' enjoy today. At the end of the day, of course, it is our judgement in all such matters, you may well disagree with that, and we can only say in our defence that we have been as objective as possible after lengthy and detailed research.

71850.name: Rise of Magic
71850.description:
From the back of the sourcebook:

Nothing is what it seems in the ever changing setting of Rifts Chaos Earth. First the Great Cataclysm and the collapse of human civilization, followed by the demon Plagues, and now Magic has returned to Earth in ways nobody could ever have imagined.

Ordinary people are developing magical powers and spell casting abilities. Some use their powers for good, other for their own gain and others to kill and destroy.

The secrets of magic wait for you inside.


Seven new types of practitioners of magic: Zone Wizard, D-Shifter, Chaos Witch, Demonbringer, Demon Caller and Demon Disciple, plus the Death Mage and others.
Five sub-classes of the Chaos Wizard.
101 new and different spells for Chaos Magic.
Compatible with Rifts and all its sourcebooks
For use with Rifts Chaos Earth.

71851.name: Nine
71851.description:
This trick-taking game is a standard deck playing card game and can be played in teams or not. The deck is dealt and each player is given thirteen cards; if played in partnerships, partners sit across the table from each other.

Players begin the game with 9 points. The goal is to reach 0.

Play begins with a person leading a trick, other players must follow suit if possible. If a player is void in the led suit, the player can play off or cut in with trump.

The trump suits change each round. The order of trump is: heart, diamond, spade, club and no trump. So The first turn the trump suit is heart, the second turn diamond. et c.

Players gain or lose points by number of tricks taken. 5 tricks or more is -1 point, 4 tricks is +0 points, and 3 or fewer is +1 point. The first person to 0 points wins.

71852.name: Mission Force: CyberStorm
71852.description:
"MissionForce: Cyberstorm (commonly referred to as "Cyberstorm") is a turn-based strategy game developed by Dynamix and published in 1996 by Sierra Entertainment. The game is set in the Earthsiege universe created by Dynamix, and the player control units of HERCs (Humaniform-Emulation Roboticized Combat Unit with Leg-Articulated Navigation): bipedal warmachines of varying size and construct. Although Cyberstorm was a limited commercial success, it sold well enough to spawn a 1998 sequel called Cyberstorm 2: Corporate Wars."

Source: Wikipedia, "MissionForce:_CyberStorm," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

71853.name: Prince of Persia: The Forgotten Sands (Wii)

videogameseries.9580: Prince of Persia: The Sands of Time

videogamehonor.33094: 2011 CVA Best Narration of the Year Nominee

71853.description:
User Information:
The Wii version of The Forgotten Sands shares only a name with the other console releases by the same name. Telling a different story, the game was designed specifically for the Wii, rather than being a less-complex port.

From the publisher

"Embark on an adventure to an exotic land and unleash your legendary moves on enemies as the acclaimed Prince of Persia: Sands of Time story line makes its return. Unfolding with the mystery and powerful narrative that have become classic elements in this series, Prince of Persia: The Forgotten Sands challenges you to unleash powerful offensive attacks and destroy your enemies. Race against time in an unforgiving world as you experience the return of the vaunted Prince of Persia.

Journey to a land of legendary combat and mysterious circumstances in this new installment to the Prince of Persia: Sands of Time franchise. Prepare yourself for impossible battles and know that you will come face to face with death as you engage in deadly combat. Experience many of your favorite elements from the original series as well as new gameplay innovations. The mystery and magic of the old-as-time fight between good and evil comes to life with all its rewards and consequences in Prince of Persia: The Forgotten Sands.

Features:

* Latest installment in the Prince of Persia: Sands of Time story line
* Encounter enemies determined to take you down
* Confront the danger that lurks around you in a land of mystery and intrigue
* Unleash powerful offensive battle measures against opposing forces
* Face off against well-matched enemies in battles of deadly significance

Marking the next-gen console debut of Ubisoft’s critically acclaimed series, Prince of Persia - The Forgotten Sands is the next chapter in the fan-favorite Sands of Time universe. Visiting his brother’s kingdom following his adventure in Azad, the Prince finds the royal palace under siege from a mighty army bent on its destruction. His brother Malik decides to use the ancient power of the Sand in a desperate gamble to save the kingdom from total annihilation. To save the kingdom, the Prince must embark on an epic adventure in which he will learn to bear the mantle of true leadership, and that great power often comes with a great cost. Wii owners will get the original 1992 Prince of Persia game as a bonus included on disc. "

71854.name: Final Fight 2
71854.description:
"Final Fight 2 is a side-scrolling beat 'em up released by Capcom for the Super Nintendo Entertainment System in 1993. It is a sequel to the coin-operated video game Final Fight (which was also released for the SNES). Final Fight 2 was developed by Capcom's consumer division with no preceding coin-op version produced."

Source: Wikipedia, "Final_Fight_2," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

71855.name: Prince of Persia: The Forgotten Sands (DS)

videogameseries.9580: Prince of Persia: The Sands of Time

videogamehonor.33094: 2011 CVA Best Narration of the Year Nominee

71855.description:
User Information:
The DS version of The Forgotten Sands is aimed at a younger audience then the standard console release, with the game almost playing itself, relying on the player to steer the Prince as he moves through the game. The game features a different story as well, with the prince having to regain his memories and powers as he escapes from India to Persia.

From the publisher

Embark on an adventure to an exotic land and unleash your legendary moves on enemies as the acclaimed Prince of Persia: Sands of Time story line makes its return. Unfolding with the mystery and powerful narrative that have become classic elements in this series, Prince of Persia: The Forgotten Sands challenges you to unleash powerful offensive attacks and destroy your enemies. Race against time in an unforgiving world as you experience the return of the vaunted Prince of Persia.

Journey to a land of legendary combat and mysterious circumstances in this new installment to the Prince of Persia: Sands of Time franchise. Prepare yourself for impossible battles and know that you will come face to face with death as you engage in deadly combat. Experience many of your favorite elements from the original series as well as new gameplay innovations. The mystery and magic of the old-as-time fight between good and evil comes to life with all its rewards and consequences in Prince of Persia: The Forgotten Sands.

* Latest installment in the Prince of Persia: Sands of Time story line
* Encounter enemies determined to take you down
* Confront the danger that lurks around you in a land of mystery and intrigue
* Unleash powerful offensive battle measures against opposing forces
* Face off against well-matched enemies in battles of deadly significance

Marking the next-gen console debut of Ubisoft’s critically acclaimed series, Prince of Persia - The Forgotten Sands is the next chapter in the fan-favorite Sands of Time universe. Visiting his brother’s kingdom following his adventure in Azad, the Prince finds the royal palace under siege from a mighty army bent on its destruction. His brother Malik decides to use the ancient power of the Sand in a desperate gamble to save the kingdom from total annihilation. To save the kingdom, the Prince must embark on an epic adventure in which he will learn to bear the mantle of true leadership, and that great power often comes with a great cost.

71856.name: Excitebots: Trick Racing
71856.description:
From the back of the North American edition case

"Racing Redefined!

Grab the Wii Wheel accessory (optional, sold separately) and prepare for a wild ride where anything goes! Pilot your bot off massive jumps, crash through bowling pins, spin around high wires, or assemble poker hands in the craziest races ever, then take on your friends in local or online multiplayer!"

71857.name: Final Fight 3
71857.description:
"Final Fight 3, released in Japan as Final Fight Tough (ファイナルファイト タフ?), is a side-scrolling beat 'em up by Capcom originally released for the Super Nintendo Entertainment System in 1995. It is the second sequel to Final Fight released for the Super NES, following Final Fight 2, and like its predecessor, it was produced by Capcom's consumer division with no preceding arcade version released."

Source: Wikipedia, "Final_Fight_3," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

71858.name: Prince of Persia: The Forgotten Sands (PSP)

videogameseries.9580: Prince of Persia: The Sands of Time

videogamehonor.33094: 2011 CVA Best Narration of the Year Nominee

71858.description:
User Information:
Unlike the main console version of the game, The Forgotten Sands on the PSP is a side-scroller, with a separate story to complement the other games.

From the publisher:

Embark on an adventure to an exotic land and unleash your legendary moves on enemies as the acclaimed Prince of Persia: Sands of Time story line makes its return. Unfolding with the mystery and powerful narrative that have become classic elements in this series, Prince of Persia: The Forgotten Sands challenges you to unleash powerful offensive attacks and destroy your enemies. Race against time in an unforgiving world as you experience the return of the vaunted Prince of Persia.

Journey to a land of legendary combat and mysterious circumstances in this new installment to the Prince of Persia: Sands of Time franchise. Prepare yourself for impossible battles and know that you will come face to face with death as you engage in deadly combat. Experience many of your favorite elements from the original series as well as new gameplay innovations. The mystery and magic of the old-as-time fight between good and evil comes to life with all its rewards and consequences in Prince of Persia: The Forgotten Sands.

* Latest installment in the Prince of Persia: Sands of Time story line
* Encounter enemies determined to take you down
* Confront the danger that lurks around you in a land of mystery and intrigue
* Unleash powerful offensive battle measures against opposing forces
* Face off against well-matched enemies in battles of deadly significance

Marking the next-gen console debut of Ubisoft’s critically acclaimed series, Prince of Persia - The Forgotten Sands is the next chapter in the fan-favorite Sands of Time universe. His brother Malik decides to use the ancient power of the Sand in a desperate gamble to save the kingdom from total annihilation. To save the kingdom, the Prince must embark on an epic adventure in which he will learn to bear the mantle of true leadership, and that great power often comes with a great cost.

71859.name: God Hand

videogamefranchise.6399: The Best (Best Selling PlayStation Games, JP)

videogamehonor.31003: 2006 Spike Best Fighting Game of the Year Nominee

71859.description:
"God Hand (ゴッドハンド, Goddohando) is the video game directed by Shinji Mikami. It was developed by Clover Studio and published by Capcom for the PlayStation 2 video game console. God Hand was released in 2006 in Japan and North America and in 2007 in PAL territories. Capcom announced just days after the game's North American ship date that it would dissolve Clover Studio, making God Hand the developer's final game released.

God Hand puts players in the role of Gene, a martial artist who is bestowed with one of the legendary "God Hands", a pair of divine arms that were once used to save the world from a demon called Angra. Gene and his companion Olivia are eventually caught up in an attempt by a group of demons known as the Four Devas to resurrect Angra for purposes of world domination. The game mixes western and Japanese-themed comedy, containing over-the-top characters and storyline events. The gameplay combines traditional elements of the beat 'em up genre with new features. These include being able to map and string together a large repertoire of fighting techniques to the gamepad's face buttons in order to create unique combo attacks.

God Hand was directed by celebrated Resident Evil designer Shinji Mikami, whose desire was to create an action game aimed at "hardcore gamers" intermixed with a large amount of comic relief. The game received an overall lightly positive response from critics. God Hand sold only modestly upon its release in Japan."

Source: Wikipedia, "God_Hand," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

71860.name: Prince of Persia: The Forgotten Sands

videogameseries.9580: Prince of Persia: The Sands of Time

videogamehonor.33094: 2011 CVA Best Narration of the Year Nominee

71860.description:
From the publisher:

Embark on an adventure to an exotic land and unleash your legendary moves on enemies as the acclaimed Prince of Persia: Sands of Time story line makes its return. Unfolding with the mystery and powerful narrative that have become classic elements in this series, Prince of Persia: The Forgotten Sands challenges you to unleash powerful offensive attacks and destroy your enemies. Race against time in an unforgiving world as you experience the return of the vaunted Prince of Persia.

Journey to a land of legendary combat and mysterious circumstances in this new installment to the Prince of Persia: Sands of Time franchise. Prepare yourself for impossible battles and know that you will come face to face with death as you engage in deadly combat. Experience many of your favorite elements from the original series as well as new gameplay innovations. The mystery and magic of the old-as-time fight between good and evil comes to life with all its rewards and consequences in Prince of Persia: The Forgotten Sands.

* Latest installment in the Prince of Persia: Sands of Time story line
